channel.title: Official Final Aryan Updater Released (Updates in seconds)
channel.description:
http://easybakejews.com/smf/index.php?topic=28.msg104#msg104
Linked at the bottom is a tarball of our updater suite. It's not an easy process if you don't know what you're doing, and I made no effort to make it intuitive for the uninitiated, but it's very stable. We've had a handful of broken rules since 347, when Kamu and I tossed it together. There is no documentation provided. You need to deal with the deobbing process on your own; as input, the run.sh script takes two different jar files: one containing the class files which have been run through saev's deobber and ZKM, and another which contains the decompiled forms of those. You will need a publiciser transformer for the deobber, that's up to you, unless Sean releases his class. Disabling the ubfolder transformer in the deobber's run.xml will prevent the animation error from occuring, so you should do that, as well. All source files should have standard Unix newlines -- you will need to run dos2unix on the .java files if you're in win32. Beyond that, just read the run.sh script to see the individual steps. Some of them, such as packaging the client and running middleman.pl, are not necessary for the Aryan version which most people have, but they are for the version which was just leaked. If you can't manage to understand the run.sh script, just give up now, this updater is not for you. All of my code is being released under an implicit BSD license. Meaning you can do whatever the hell you want with it, provided you (theoretically) give credit. Since you're all 12 years old, or at least exhibit the mindsets of prepubescent little boys, I'm not getting my hopes up. Best of luck. http://rapidshare.de/files/19515457/factor.tgz.html

item.dc:creator: @Teh_Freak Teh Freak
item.description:
@Teh_Freak wrote:

Well, sad to see it publically released, guess my fun is over, and now we come to many fucking retards autoing constantly to fuck it up for everyone, but yea, its a nice updater, took me a few tries to get it working, but finally got it, and yea, i guess itll help people out.

item.source: Official Final Aryan Updater Released (Updates in seconds)

item.title: Official Final Aryan Updater Released (Updates in seconds)
item.dc:creator: @xSignal xSignal
item.description:
@xSignal wrote:

[quote=“sdouble, post:6, topic:2319”]Yeah, it is a damn fine updater. I would say it’s a good thing that it was released because now everyone can see the quality of it, but I know better. It’s just going to be “how get 2 wrk? i dun no wot 2 do wit dis” and “da rulez is broked, i only 12 yrs old” Anyway, enjoy.

Here is a sample:

-> running factor
Time started: Wed May 3 11:42:57 CDT 2006
Running factor suite
– Running parser
– Running renamer
2040 constant entries renamed in 1625ms
– Packaging
– Decompiling
– Fixing bad class
– Making final jar files
Preparing for use with Aryan
Time completed: Wed May 3 11:43:16 CDT 2006
-> factor complete

Check out the time started and time completed. Now everyone can experience this and be terribly ungrateful.[/quote]
Hey! I am 12

Read full topic

[quote=pd]Linked at the bottom is a tarball of our updater suite.

It’s not an easy process if you don’t know what you’re doing, and I made no effort to make it intuitive for the uninitiated, but it’s very stable. We’ve had a handful of broken rules since 347, when Kamu and I tossed it together. There is no documentation provided.

You need to deal with the deobbing process on your own; as input, the run.sh script takes two different jar files: one containing the class files which have been run through saev’s deobber and ZKM, and another which contains the decompiled forms of those. You will need a publiciser transformer for the deobber, that’s up to you, unless Sean releases his class. Disabling the ubfolder transformer in the deobber’s run.xml will prevent the animation error from occuring, so you should do that, as well. All source files should have standard Unix newlines – you will need to run dos2unix on the .java files if you’re in win32.

Beyond that, just read the run.sh script to see the individual steps. Some of them, such as packaging the client and running middleman.pl, are not necessary for the Aryan version which most people have, but they are for the version which was just leaked. If you can’t manage to understand the run.sh script, just give up now, this updater is not for you.

All of my code is being released under an implicit BSD license. Meaning you can do whatever the hell you want with it, provided you (theoretically) give credit. Since you’re all 12 years old, or at least exhibit the mindsets of prepubescent little boys, I’m not getting my hopes up.

Best of luck.

http://rapidshare.de/files/19515457/factor.tgz.html[/quote][/quote]

http://easybakejews.com/smf/index.php?topic=28.msg104#msg104

Linked at the bottom is a tarball of our updater suite.

It’s not an easy process if you don’t know what you’re doing, and I made no effort to make it intuitive for the uninitiated, but it’s very stable. We’ve had a handful of broken rules since 347, when Kamu and I tossed it together. There is no documentation provided.

You need to deal with the deobbing process on your own; as input, the run.sh script takes two different jar files: one containing the class files which have been run through saev’s deobber and ZKM, and another which contains the decompiled forms of those. If you can’t manage to understand the run.sh script, just give up now, this updater is not for you.

All of my code is being released under an implicit BSD license. Meaning you can do whatever the hell you want with it, provided you (theoretically) give credit. Since you’re all 12 years old, or at least exhibit the mindsets of prepubescent little boys, I’m not getting my hopes up.
